intro: Ceratanthus becquerelii, commonly known as the Becquerel's ceratanthus, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and clusters of blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is known for its ornamental value due to its vibrant flower color and compact growth habit. Ceratanthus becquerelii is also valued in horticulture for its ability to tolerate drought and poor soil conditions.
